parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(lit: blunted) dumb, dull, deaf. From kopto; blunted, i.e. of hearing or speech.
One speaking with difficulty, a stammerer. From mogis and laleo; hardly talking, i.e. Dumb.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
